SENT.plain: Behçet's disease can be revealed by neurologic signs
CASE REPORTS: We report two pediatric cases of Behçet's disease which initially presented with cerebral venous thrombosis
Glucocorticoïds, associated with anticoagulant treatment allowed a rapid recovery
One of the children presented three years later a thrombotic recurrence
CONCLUSION: A cerebral venous thrombosis may reveal Behçet's disease
